meanings.definition: To add or attach something to something else.
meanings.sent1: She subjoins the new piece to the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: He always subjoins a note to his gifts.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel subjoins a shiny rock to its collection of nuts.
meanings.sent4: The artist subjoins bold colors to create a striking masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The chef subjoins unique flavors to make her dishes unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: The bridge subjoins the two sides of the river.
meanings.sent2: The train subjoins different cities along its route.
meanings.sent3: The magician subjoins two rings together in a surprising trick.
meanings.sent4: Music subjoins people from different cultures in harmony.
meanings.sent5: Love subjoins hearts in a powerful bond.
